source_document.title: Axis Air Force in North Africa, 18 January 1942

aggregate_strength.note: Aggregate strength from Wikipedia (Regia Aeronautica maintained ~400 aircraft in Libya, 60-70% operational). Organization with 22 units from Nafziger Collection.

sources: Wikipedia - Regia Aeronautica article (general North Africa strength: ~400 aircraft, 60-70% operational)
Nafziger Collection - 942game.pdf (18 January 1942 organizational structure with 22 units)
metadata.extraction_method: Hybrid: Wikipedia general aggregate + Nafziger organization
metadata.notes: Organizational structure with 22 units (gruppi and squadriglie) from Nafziger Collection (18 Jan 1942). General aggregate strength (~400 aircraft, 60-70% operational rate = 240-280 operational) from Wikipedia Regia Aeronautica article. Individual unit strengths not available in free sources. Standard Italian establishment: ~9 aircraft per squadriglia, ~27 per gruppo (3 squadriglie). Detailed Italian air force records may exist in Italian Ufficio Storico archives.
metadata.future_enhancement: Italian air force historical archives or specialist publications for exact unit strengths
